cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles ENE of St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest, then turning northwest toward the Turks & Caicos, the Bahamas, and eventually South Florida
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just south of the Miami–Florida Keys corridor

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watches in effect for Cuba from Matanzas eastward and the Central Bahamas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warnings for the northern Leeward Islands, U.S./British Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, northern Dominican Republic, northern Haiti, Turks & Caicos, and the Southeastern Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Leeward Islands through Turks & Caicos, Bahamas, Cuba, and the Florida peninsula including PortMiami
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (≥70%) of tropical-storm-force winds at PortMiami by late Saturday night with a growing (>50%) chance of 50-kt winds Sunday; hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge of 3–6 ft possible along Biscayne Bay and adjacent Atlantic coast if Irma tracks near or just south of the port
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 5–10 inches of rainfall with locally higher totals, producing flash-flood risk around the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large battering waves, dangerous rip currents, and possible tornadoes in rainbands
